original: skyed par byed cing rdzing na gnas pa'i padma bzhin myur du skyed par byed do //
analyzed: skyed par byed cing rdzing na gnas pa'i padma bzhin myur du skyed par byed do //
translated: and he grew quickly, like a lotus in a pond.

original: de gang gi tshe chen por gyur pa de'i tshe na yi ge dang grangs dang / rtsis dang / lag rtsis dang / dbyung ba dang / gzhug pa dang / gzhag pa dang / 'byed pa dang / klog pa'i pha rol tu son cing /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe chen por gyur pa de'i tshe na yi ge dang grangs dang / rtsis dang / lag rtsis dang / dbyung ba dang / gzhug pa dang / gzhag pa dang / 'byed pa dang / klog pa'i pha rol tu son cing /
translated: When he grew up, he became skilled in reading and writing, in counting, in reckoning, in doing computations, in doing arithmetical operations, in doing calculations, in doing evaluations, in doing estimations, and in doing measurements.

original: de'i tshe na bram ze'i spyod tshul dang / spyod pa dang / gtsang sbra dang / @238b kun tu spyod pa dang / thal ba blang ba dang / bya ma bum blang ba dang / sa blang ba dang / lag stangs dang / thor tshugs dang /
analyzed: de'i tshe na bram ze'i spyod tshul dang / spyod pa dang / gtsang sbra dang / @238b kun tu spyod pa dang / thal ba blang ba dang / bya ma bum blang ba dang / sa blang ba dang / lag stangs dang / thor tshugs dang /
translated: He became skilled in the conduct, behavior, purity, and practice of brahmins, in collecting ashes, in collecting cow’s urine, in collecting earth, in hand gestures, in topknots,

original: rab bsngags bye ba dang / kye zhes bya ba dang / nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / bram ze'i las drug po mchod sbyin byed pa dang /
analyzed: rab bsngags bye ba dang / kye zhes bya ba dang / nges brjod kyi rig byed dang / mchod sbyin gyi rig byed dang / snyan tshig gi rig byed dang / srid srung gi rig byed dang / bram ze'i las drug po mchod sbyin byed pa dang /
translated: in the Vedas of the brahmins, in the Vedas of the sacrifices, in the Vedas of the hymns, in the Vedas of the rituals, and in the six duties of brahmins, in performing sacrifices,

original: mchod sbyin byed du 'dzud pa dang / klog pa dang klog tu 'dzud pa dang / sbyin pa dang len pa la mkhas pa'i bram ze'i rig byed dang rig byed kyi yan lag gi pha rol tu son pa me lta bu'i shes pas rang gi smra ba gsal bar byed pa /
analyzed: mchod sbyin byed du 'dzud pa dang / klog pa dang klog tu 'dzud pa dang / sbyin pa dang len pa la mkhas pa'i bram ze'i rig byed dang rig byed kyi yan lag gi pha rol tu son pa me lta bu'i shes pas rang gi smra ba gsal bar byed pa /
translated: He was skilled in giving and receiving, and he had mastered the Vedas and the Vedāṅgas. He was like a fire in his knowledge, and he illuminated his own speech.🔽He was able to refute the speech of others.

original: gzhan gyi smra ba tshar gcod nus par gyur to; ;de'i tshe bram ze ser skya zhi bas bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya tsam dag bram ze'i gsang tshig dag 'don du bcug go /
analyzed: gzhan gyi smra ba tshar gcod nus par gyur to; ;de'i tshe bram ze ser skya zhi bas bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya tsam dag bram ze'i gsang tshig dag 'don du bcug go /
translated: At that time, the brahmin Kapilaśānti had about five hundred young brahmins reciting the secret words of the brahmins.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na shed bu ser skya klog par byed pas pha la smras pa /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na shed bu ser skya klog par byed pas pha la smras pa /
translated: At one point, the young brahmin Kapila, while reciting, asked his father,

original: yab ri tsa zhes bgyi ba 'di'i don ci lags /
analyzed: yab ri tsa zhes bgyi ba 'di'i don ci lags /
translated: “Father, what is the meaning of this word ‘ṛṣi’?”

original: ser skya zhi bas smras pa /
analyzed: ser skya zhi bas smras pa /
translated: Kapilaśānti said,

original: bu yi ge dag ni yun ring po nas bral ba dag ste /
analyzed: bu yi ge dag ni yun ring po nas bral ba dag ste /
translated: “Son, the letters have been separated for a long time.

original: bla ma'i tshig shes par dka' ba yin pas /
analyzed: bla ma'i tshig shes par dka' ba yin pas /
translated: The words of the guru are difficult to understand.

original: drang srong de dag gis don dang bral ba'i bstan bcos nye bar sbyar ba 'di ci yin mi shes so //
analyzed: drang srong de dag gis don dang bral ba'i bstan bcos nye bar sbyar ba 'di ci yin mi shes so //
translated: “We do not know what this treatise, devoid of meaning, is about.”

original: ser skyas smras pa /
analyzed: ser skyas smras pa /
translated: Kapila said,

original: yab bdag gis ri tsa zhes bgyi ba 'di'i don de 'tshal to //
analyzed: yab bdag gis ri tsa zhes bgyi ba 'di'i don de 'tshal to //
translated: “Father, I understand the meaning of this ‘peak of existence.’”

original: bram ze ser skya zhi bas bsams pa /🔽'di ltar phas bu la bdag dang mnyam pa'am /
analyzed: bram ze ser skya zhi bas bsams pa / 'di ltar phas bu la bdag dang mnyam pa'am /
translated: The brahmin Kapila thought,

original: khyad par du 'phags pa de ni 'dod par bya ba yin pas /
analyzed: khyad par du 'phags pa de ni 'dod par bya ba yin pas /
translated: “In this way, a father desires a son who is equal to him or who is superior to him.

original: de'i phyir 'ang bdag pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin gyis /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'ang bdag pas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin gyis /
translated: Therefore, I am superior to him.

original: bdag gis 'di la bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po 'di dag gtad par @239a *//
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po 'di dag gtad par @239a *//
translated: I will entrust these five hundred young brahmins to him.”

original: bya'o snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: bya'o snyam du rig nas /
translated: Having understood this,

original: bram ze'i khye'u ser skya la smras pa /
analyzed: bram ze'i khye'u ser skya la smras pa /
translated: he said to the young brahmin Kapila,

original: bu 'di ltar phas bu la bdag dang mnyam pa'am khyad par du 'phags pa de ni 'dod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir khyod kho bo bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin gyis /
analyzed: bu 'di ltar phas bu la bdag dang mnyam pa'am khyad par du 'phags pa de ni 'dod par bya ba yin pas de'i phyir khyod kho bo bas ches khyad par du 'phags pa yin gyis /
translated: “Son, in this way, a father desires a son who is equal to him or who is superior to him. Therefore, you are superior to me.

original: khyod kyis bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po 'di dag bram ze'i gsang tshig dag 'don du chug cig /
analyzed: khyod kyis bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po 'di dag bram ze'i gsang tshig dag 'don du chug cig /
translated: “You should have these five hundred young brahmins recite the secret mantra of the brahmins.”

original: ser skyas smras pa /
analyzed: ser skyas smras pa /
translated: Kapila said, “As you wish.”

original: bka' bzhin 'tshal 'don du stsal te zhes des bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po de dag bram ze'i gsang tshig dag 'don du gzhug par brtsams so //
analyzed: bka' bzhin 'tshal 'don du stsal te zhes des bram ze'i khye'u lnga brgya po de dag bram ze'i gsang tshig dag 'don du gzhug par brtsams so //
translated: He had the five hundred young brahmins recite the secret mantra of the brahmins.

original: bram ze ser skya zhi ba yang bya ba med cing cir dgar 'gro ba dang spyod pas dga' mgur spyod par brtsams so //
analyzed: bram ze ser skya zhi ba yang bya ba med cing cir dgar 'gro ba dang spyod pas dga' mgur spyod par brtsams so //
translated: The brahmin Kapila Śvetaketu, having nothing to do, went wherever he liked and began to enjoy himself.

original: de dus gzhan zhig na drang srong smra bar song ste /
analyzed: de dus gzhan zhig na drang srong smra bar song ste /
translated: At one time, he went to the Ṛṣivadana and

original: der dge slong zhig gi gan du song nas smras pa /
analyzed: der dge slong zhig gi gan du song nas smras pa /
translated: approached a monk and said,

original: slob dpon tshig 'di'i don ci lags /
analyzed: slob dpon tshig 'di'i don ci lags /
translated: “Teacher, what is the meaning of this statement?”

original: dge slong des smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong des smras pa /
translated: The monk said,

original: tshe dang ldan pa dri ba de ni de skad dri bar mi bya ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dri ba de ni de skad dri bar mi bya ste /
translated: “Venerable, that question should not be asked in that way.

original: dri ba de de skad dris na yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ba de de skad dris na yongs su rdzogs par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that question is asked in that way, it will not be fully answered.

original: 'di ltar dri ba de ni 'di skad dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar dri ba de ni 'di skad dri bar bya ste /
translated: Rather, that question should be asked in this way:

original: dri ba de 'di skad dris na tshig 'di'i don 'di yin no zhes yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri ba de 'di skad dris na tshig 'di'i don 'di yin no zhes yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the question is asked in this way, it will be completely answered.”

original: bram ze ser skya zhi bas bsams pa /
analyzed: bram ze ser skya zhi bas bsams pa /
translated: The brahmin Pāṭikāputra thought,

original: bdag gis 'di dag la dri ba yang 'dri bar mi nus na bdag gis 'di dag dang lhan cig ji ltar smra bar 'gyur snyam nas /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di dag la dri ba yang 'dri bar mi nus na bdag gis 'di dag dang lhan cig ji ltar smra bar 'gyur snyam nas /
translated: “I cannot even ask them questions. How can I debate with them?”

original: de dge slong rnams la shin tu mngon par dad par gyur nas /
analyzed: de dge slong rnams la shin tu mngon par dad par gyur nas /
translated: He became a devoted follower of the monks.

original: dus dang dus su dge slong dag mgron du pos te khyim gzhan du zan sbyin par byed do //
analyzed: dus dang dus su dge slong dag mgron du pos te khyim gzhan du zan sbyin par byed do //
translated: From time to time he invited the monks to his house and gave them food.

original: de dus gzhan zhig nan par gyur nas des shed bu ser skya la smras pa /
analyzed: de dus gzhan zhig nan par gyur nas des shed bu ser skya la smras pa /
translated: Later, when he was old, he said to his son Pāṭikā,

original: bu ji tsam na nyi ma @239b 'char ba dang / ji tsam na nub pa de'i bar du khyod dang 'dra ba'i smra ba gzhan med kyis de'i phyir khyod kyis kho bo 'das nas /
analyzed: bu ji tsam na nyi ma @239b 'char ba dang / ji tsam na nub pa de'i bar du khyod dang 'dra ba'i smra ba gzhan med kyis de'i phyir khyod kyis kho bo 'das nas /
translated: “Son, from the time the sun rises until it sets, there is no one who can speak like you. Therefore, after I die,

original: smra ba thams cad dang lhan cig 'jigs pa med pa dang / bag tsha ba med par smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: smra ba thams cad dang lhan cig 'jigs pa med pa dang / bag tsha ba med par smra bar bya'o //
translated: you must debate with all the speakers without fear or hesitation.”

original: 'od srung gi dge sbyong rnams ni ma gtogs te /🔽de dag ni rgyud rgya chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: 'od srung gi dge sbyong rnams ni ma gtogs te / de dag ni rgyud rgya chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: except for the monks of Kāśyapa.🔽They have vast continuums.

original: rgyud zab mo dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgyud zab mo dang ldan pa /
translated: They have profound continuums.

original: rgyud bzang po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rgyud bzang po dang ldan pa /
translated: They have excellent continuums.

original: 'jig rten pa las pham par mi nus pa /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa las pham par mi nus pa /
translated: They cannot be defeated by worldly people.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa la gting med pa yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa la gting med pa yin te /
translated: They are unfathomable to worldly people.

original: de dag ni mang ba dang / mthun pa dang / longs spyod dag don du mi gnyer ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni mang ba dang / mthun pa dang / longs spyod dag don du mi gnyer ba yin no //
translated: They do not pursue the goals of having many followers, being in agreement with others, or having wealth.

original: ser skyas smras pa yab de bzhin bgyi'o //
analyzed: ser skyas smras pa yab de bzhin bgyi'o //
translated: Kapila said, “Father, I will do as you say.”

original: bram ze ser skya zhi ba na ba las ma langs te de rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu'i sman dag gis bsnyen bkur byas kyang nyams pa nyid du gyur nas /
analyzed: bram ze ser skya zhi ba na ba las ma langs te de rtsa ba dang sdong bu dang 'dab ma dang / me tog dang 'bras bu'i sman dag gis bsnyen bkur byas kyang nyams pa nyid du gyur nas /
translated: The brahmin Kapila Śvetāśvatarāśi did not recover from his illness, even though he was treated with medicinal roots, stalks, leaves, flowers, and fruits.

original: ci tsam na /
analyzed: ci tsam na /
translated: He thought,

original: bsags pa kun gyi mtha' zad cing //
analyzed: bsags pa kun gyi mtha' zad cing //
translated: “The end of all accumulations is depletion.

original: mthon po rnams kyi mtha' ltung 'gyur //
analyzed: mthon po rnams kyi mtha' ltung 'gyur //
translated: The end of being high is falling.

original: phrad pa'i mtha' ni 'bral ba ste //
analyzed: phrad pa'i mtha' ni 'bral ba ste //
translated: The end of meeting is separation.

original: gson pa'i mtha' ni 'chi ba yin //
analyzed: gson pa'i mtha' ni 'chi ba yin //
translated: The end of being alive is death.”

original: zhes bya ba yin pas dus kyi chos rnams dang ldan par gyur to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba yin pas dus kyi chos rnams dang ldan par gyur to //
translated: Thus, he was endowed with the qualities of the time.

original: de shed bu ser skya dang / nang mis gos sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dag gis khyogs spyil brgyan te /
analyzed: de shed bu ser skya dang / nang mis gos sngon po dang ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dag gis khyogs spyil brgyan te /
translated: His father Kapila and his family decorated the bier with blue, yellow, red, and white cloth.

original: dur khrod du bskyal nas /
analyzed: dur khrod du bskyal nas /
translated: They carried him to the charnel ground,

original: bsregs te de'i 'og tu mya ngan bsangs pa byas nas 'khod do //
analyzed: bsregs te de'i 'og tu mya ngan bsangs pa byas nas 'khod do //
translated: cremated him, and then sat down to console each other.

original: lho phyogs nas lhags pa'i smra ba de dag gis bram ze ser skya zhi ba dus la bab ces thos so //
analyzed: lho phyogs nas lhags pa'i smra ba de dag gis bram ze ser skya zhi ba dus la bab ces thos so //
translated: The logicians who had come from the south heard that the brahmin Kapila had died.

original: thos nas kyang phan tshun smra bar brtsams pa /
analyzed: thos nas kyang phan tshun smra bar brtsams pa /
translated: Having heard this, they began to discuss it among themselves:

original: shes ldan dag bram ze smra ba de dus la bab gyis /
analyzed: shes ldan dag bram ze smra ba de dus la bab gyis /
translated: “Sirs, the time has come for the brahmin Kapila, the logician.

original: da ni 'dong bar bya'o zhes de dag thams cad @240a *//
analyzed: da ni 'dong bar bya'o zhes de dag thams cad @240a *//
translated: Now we must go there.”

original: 'dus te rgyal po kri kri'i gan du dong ngo //
analyzed: 'dus te rgyal po kri kri'i gan du dong ngo //
translated: They all gathered together and went to King Kṛkī.

original: de nas rgyal po la rgyal ba dang / tshe spel ba byas te smras pa /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po la rgyal ba dang / tshe spel ba byas te smras pa /
translated: Then they wished the king victory and long life and said,🔽“Your Majesty, the time has come for the brahmin Kapila, the logician.

original: lha bdag cag la bla ma las yi ge nyung shas shig blangs pa mchis te bdag cag lha'i spyan sngar bka' mchid rnam par gtan la dbab par bgyid par 'tshal lo //
analyzed: lha bdag cag la bla ma las yi ge nyung shas shig blangs pa mchis te bdag cag lha'i spyan sngar bka' mchid rnam par gtan la dbab par bgyid par 'tshal lo //
translated: We have received a few letters from the Guru, and we wish to settle the matter in the presence of the gods.

original: rgyal pos blon po rnams la smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos blon po rnams la smras pa /
translated: The king said to his ministers:

original: shes ldan dag mkhan po de bos shig /
analyzed: shes ldan dag mkhan po de bos shig /
translated: Sirs, summon the Guru.

original: blon po rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: blon po rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The ministers said:

original: lha bram ze smra ba de dus la bab bo //
analyzed: lha bram ze smra ba de dus la bab bo //
translated: Your Majesty, the time has come for the Brahman to speak.

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said:

original: de'i phyir 'di dag g-yul du phug ron bzhin du 'dus te nga'i drung du lhags kyis bram ze de'i bu'am phu nu po 'ga' ci yod /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di dag g-yul du phug ron bzhin du 'dus te nga'i drung du lhags kyis bram ze de'i bu'am phu nu po 'ga' ci yod /
translated: Since they have gathered like pigeons in battle and have come before me, does the Brahman have a son or a brother?

original: lha de'i bu shed bu ser skya zhes bgyi ba mchis so //
analyzed: lha de'i bu shed bu ser skya zhes bgyi ba mchis so //
translated: The ministers said: Your Majesty, he has a son named Kapila.

original: mkhan po'i bu de bos shig /
analyzed: mkhan po'i bu de bos shig /
translated: The king said: Summon the son of the Guru.

original: de dag gis de bos nas /
analyzed: de dag gis de bos nas /
translated: They summoned him.

original: des rgyal po la rgyal ba dang / tshe spel ba byas te mtha' gcig tu 'dug pa dang / blon po rnams kyis smras pa; lha de'i bu shed bu ser skya zhes bgyi ba 'di lags so //
analyzed: des rgyal po la rgyal ba dang / tshe spel ba byas te mtha' gcig tu 'dug pa dang / blon po rnams kyis smras pa; lha de'i bu shed bu ser skya zhes bgyi ba 'di lags so //
translated: He wished the king victory and long life, and then sat down to one side. The ministers said, “Your Majesty, this is the son of the master, the one called Kapila.”

original: rgyal pos de la 'ongs pa legs so //
analyzed: rgyal pos de la 'ongs pa legs so //
translated: The king welcomed him with the words, “Welcome!”

original: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis kun tu spyad nas smras pa /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshig gis kun tu spyad nas smras pa /
translated: and then said,

original: mkhan po'i bu bram ze smra bar 'dod pa yul tha dad pa na gnas pa 'di dag nga'i drung du lhags na /
analyzed: mkhan po'i bu bram ze smra bar 'dod pa yul tha dad pa na gnas pa 'di dag nga'i drung du lhags na /
translated: “Master’s son, these brahmins who wish to debate, who come from different countries, have come before me.

original: khyod 'di dag dang lhan cig smra bar byed par nus sam /
analyzed: khyod 'di dag dang lhan cig smra bar byed par nus sam /
translated: Can you debate with them?”

original: rngo ci thogs kyis lha dgyes par bgyi'o //
analyzed: rngo ci thogs kyis lha dgyes par bgyi'o //
translated: “Whatever I can do, Your Majesty, I will do to please you.”

original: de nas rgol ba'i dkyil 'khor bshams shing phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs dag rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas rgol ba'i dkyil 'khor bshams shing phyogs dang gzhan gyi phyogs dag rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: Then the debate arena was set up, and the positions of the king and the others were arranged.

original: de dag phyogs snga ma byed du bcug pa dang / smra ba de dag bram ze ser skya dang lhan cig gzhi gang dang gang la smra ba de dang de la bram ze ser skyas spobs @240b pa med par byas nas /
analyzed: de dag phyogs snga ma byed du bcug pa dang / smra ba de dag bram ze ser skya dang lhan cig gzhi gang dang gang la smra ba de dang de la bram ze ser skyas spobs @240b pa med par byas nas /
translated: and whatever topic the brahmin Kapila discussed with those debaters, he reduced them to silence.

original: de dag cang mi smra bar 'khod do //
analyzed: de dag cang mi smra bar 'khod do //
translated: They sat there speechless.🔽Among the grounds for defeat,

original: tshar gcad pa'i gnas rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshar gcad pa'i gnas rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste /
translated: this is the worst:

original: lan la spobs pa med pa nyid ni tha chad yin no //
analyzed: lan la spobs pa med pa nyid ni tha chad yin no //
translated: to be without eloquence in reply.

original: rgyal po ngo mtshar skyes te /
analyzed: rgyal po ngo mtshar skyes te /
translated: The king was amazed.

original: ae man tshod gzhon la shes rab kyi spobs pa 'di dang 'di lta bu yod do zhes ngo mtshar skyes nas /
analyzed: ae man tshod gzhon la shes rab kyi spobs pa 'di dang 'di lta bu yod do zhes ngo mtshar skyes nas /
translated: He was amazed, saying, How can someone so young have such eloquence and wisdom?

original: de'i 'og tu mngon par dad pas glang po che'i gshul  du bskyon te smra ba'i rgyal srid la dbang bskur ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mngon par dad pas glang po che'i gshul  du bskyon te smra ba'i rgyal srid la dbang bskur ro //
translated: After that, with great faith, he placed him on the back of an elephant and consecrated him as king of debaters.

original: ser skya de'i ma sems khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa bzang po ma yin pa dag la rnam par rtog par byed de /
analyzed: ser skya de'i ma sems khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa bzang po ma yin pa dag la rnam par rtog par byed de /
translated: Kapila's mother was distressed and thought unwholesome thoughts.

original: ser skya des hab shur gyis rgol ba'i longs spyod 'phrog tu bcug ste 'ong bar mi 'gyur ram snyam du de de ltar sems khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa bzang po ma yin pa dag la rnam par rtog par byed cing 'dug pa na /
analyzed: ser skya des hab shur gyis rgol ba'i longs spyod 'phrog tu bcug ste 'ong bar mi 'gyur ram snyam du de de ltar sems khong du chud cing rnam par rtog pa bzang po ma yin pa dag la rnam par rtog par byed cing 'dug pa na /
translated: He was thinking like this, and while he was sitting there, he was thinking unwholesome thoughts.

original: shed bu ser skya smra ba'i rgyal srid la dbang bskur bas dbang bskur te /
analyzed: shed bu ser skya smra ba'i rgyal srid la dbang bskur bas dbang bskur te /

analyzed: @245b bdag cag 'di nas shi 'phos pa rnams kyi 'gro ba ni cir 'gyur /

translated: taught the Dharma that was appropriate for each, such that some understood the teachings and attained the stage of warmth, some attained the stage of summit, some attained the stage of acceptance, some attained the stage of the highest worldly dharmas, some actualized the fruit of stream-entry,

translated: some the fruit of once-returning, some the fruit of non-returning, and some, having gone forth, abandoned all defilements and actualized the fruit of arhatship.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das gdul ba'i don chen po mdzad nas gshegs so //

original: de nas chu srin nya'i rigs 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas chu srin nya'i rigs 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then the crocodile of the fish species thought,

analyzed: des zas mi za ba @246a *//🔽la zhugs so //

analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa rnams kyi me ni rno ba yin pas de bkres pas nyams dmas pa na /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la sems mngon par dad par byas nas dus la bab pa dang / rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes so //
translated: When he was weakened by hunger, he generated a mind of faith in the Blessed One. When his time came, he was born among the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings.

analyzed: lha'i bu'am lha'i bu mo'i chos nyid ni skyes nas ring po ma lon pa la sems gsum skye ste /
translated: It is the nature of gods and goddesses that, not long after birth, three thoughts arise:

analyzed: gang nas shi 'phos pa dang / gang du skyes pa dang // las gang gis skyes pa'o //

translated: He saw that he had died among animals, was born among the gods of the Heaven of the Four Great Kings, and was born there by generating a mind of faith in the Blessed One.

analyzed: de nas sngon chu srin lha'i bu de 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag yongs su gnas pa bstan te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir nye bar 'gro ba ni bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin gyis bdag yongs su gnas pa ma bsten pa kho nar bcom ldan 'das la blta ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba'i phyir nye bar 'gro'o
translated: “It is not right for me to go to see and serve the Blessed One without first attending to my own affairs. I will go to see and serve the Blessed One without attending to my own affairs.”

analyzed: snyam mo // de nas sngon chu srin lha'i bu rna cha gdub kor g-yo zhing dri ma med pa thogs te do shal dang se mo dos brgyan pa'i lus kyis lha'i autpa la dang padma dang ku mu ta dang / padma dkar po dag gis thub bkang ste /
translated: Then the god formerly a makara, wearing earrings of swaying, stainless gold, his body adorned with necklaces and bracelets, filled a divine utpala, lotus, kumuda, and white lotus with divine sandalwood powder,

analyzed: kha dog shin tu 'das pas mtshan mo la bab pa dang / bcom ldan 'das ga la ba der song ste phyin nas /

translated: He sat down to one side and the entire multi-storied palace was filled with a vast light from the radiance of the god’s body.

analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu mngon sum du byas pa de lta bur 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi yang dag par so sor rtogs par byed pa'i chos bstan pa mdzad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One, knowing the thoughts, habitual tendencies, temperament, and nature of the god formerly a makara, taught the Dharma that was appropriate for him. Having heard it, the god formerly a makara, while sitting right there, destroyed with the thunderbolt of wisdom the twenty high peaks of the mountain of views concerning the transitory collection, and manifested the resultant state of stream entry.

original: des bden pa mthong nas /
analyzed: des bden pa mthong nas /
translated: He saw the truths.

analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag la gang mdzad pa 'di lta bu ni bdag la phas kyang ma bgyis /

analyzed: mas kyang ma bgyis /
translated: “Lord, what the Blessed One has done for me is something that neither my father nor my mother,

analyzed: rgyal pos kyang ma bgyis /

analyzed: lha rnams kyis kyang ma bgyis /

analyzed: byams pa dang mdza' bshes dang rtsa lag gi tshogs dag gis kyang ma bgyis te /

analyzed: khrag dang mchi ma'i rgya mtsho ni bskam /

analyzed: rus pa'i ri dag las ni bsgral /

analyzed: ngan song gi sgo dag ni bkum mtho ris dang thar pa'i sgo dag ni phye /

analyzed: khyod mthus rab drag nyes pa mang ldan pa'i // ngan song shul bkag bsod nams rab ldan pa'i //

analyzed: lha yi 'jig rten mngon phyogs mkha' la song //

translated: Then, like a merchant who has gained profit, like a farmer who has had a good harvest, like a hero who has won a battle, like a sick person who has been completely cured of an illness,

analyzed: cha lugs gang gis bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar 'ongs pa'i cha lugs de nyid kyis rang gi gnas su song ngo //

translated: The monks, who were abiding in the practice of yoga without sleeping during the first and last periods of the night, saw a great light filling the presence of the Blessed One.

analyzed: mthong nas the tshom za ba'i yid kyis mtshan mo nam nangs pa dang / @247b bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: lha'i dbang po brgya byin yang ma yin /
translated: nor did Śakra, Lord of the Gods,

original: 'jig rten skyong ba bzhi yang ma yin /

analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ltar khyed kyis ngas chu srin nya'i rigs gang la tshig gsum gyi chos bstan pa de mthong ngam /

original: bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mthong ngo //

analyzed: dge slong dag de de nas shi 'phos te rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes nas de mdang sum nga'i gan du 'ongs te /

original: ngas de la chos bstan nas des bden pa mthong ste /
analyzed: ngas de la chos bstan nas des bden pa mthong ste /
translated: I taught him the Dharma, and he saw the truths.

original: rang gi gnas su song ngo //
analyzed: rang gi gnas su song ngo //
translated: He then returned to his own abode.”

original: yang dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: yang dge slong rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: Again, the monks asked the Blessed One,

analyzed: btsun pa sngon chu srin lha'i bus las ci bgyis na /

analyzed: des rgyal chen bzhi pa'i lha rnams kyi nang du skyes par gyur /

analyzed: las ci bgyis na des bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar bden pa mthong bar bgyis /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied,

analyzed: dge slong dag sngon chu srin lha'i bu nyid kyis las tshogs rnyed pa / rkyen yongs su bsgyur pa 'ong ba bzhin du nye bar gnas pa /

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag byas shing bsags pas /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar 'gyur ba dag byas shing bsags pas /
translated: The actions were performed and accumulated by him,🔽and so he is experiencing their results.

original: mi'i chos zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mi'i chos zhes bya ba ni mi rnams kyi chos mya ngan las 'das pa ste /

analyzed: bdag cag la dge 'dun la lhag ma'i ltung ba byung bar ma gyur tam /

analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos dge slong rab tu mang po de dag khrid de /

analyzed: sems pa yang yod pas /

analyzed: de med do zhes nga mi smra mod kyi 'di dag gi de ni tha snyad du byar rung ba ma yin te /

analyzed: kun dga' bo de lta bas na rmi lam gyi ma gtogs so //
translated: Therefore, Ānanda, I rescind this rule for those who are asleep and dreaming.”

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis bslab pa 'dod pa dang / bslab pa la gus pa dang / bslab pa la yo byad bsnyungs pa'i bsngags pa brjod nas /

original: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na snga ma ni bcas pa yin la 'di ni rjes su gnang ba yin te /

analyzed: nga'i nyan thos rnams kyis 'dul ba la bslab pa'i gzhi 'di ltar gdon par bya ste /

analyzed: bsam bzhin du khu ba phyung na rmi lam gyi ma gtogs te dge 'dun lhag ma'o //
translated: ‘If a monk intentionally emits semen, except in a dream, he commits a serious offense.’

original: bsam bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad nas so //
analyzed: bsam bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam par dpyad nas so //

analyzed: khu ba zhes bya ba ni khu ba rnam pa lnga ste /

analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / bska ba dang / sla ba'o //

analyzed: de la sngon po ni 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i'o //

analyzed: 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po'i bu thu bo dbang bskur bar 'os la /

analyzed: dmar po ni sna chen po la gtogs pa 'khor lo'i mtha' pa'i'o // bska ba ni dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Red is that of the son of the universal monarch who is the lord of the great region and the end of the wheel.🔽Astringent is that of those whose faculties are mature.

original: sla ba ni dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sla ba ni dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: Soft is that of those whose faculties are immature.

original: yang na bud med kyis dub pa dang / khur gyis dub pa dang / lam gyis dub pa dang / gta' gam pa dang / ya za ma lug gang yin pa de'i yang sla ba yin no; ;phyung na zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu phyung ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bud med kyis dub pa dang / khur gyis dub pa dang / lam gyis dub pa dang / gta' gam pa dang / ya za ma lug gang yin pa de'i yang sla ba yin no; ;phyung na zhes bya ba ni de ma thag tu phyung ba'o //
translated: or a woman who is tired, or who is carrying a heavy load, or who is tired from traveling, or who is pregnant, or who is nursing a child.🔽Except in a dream.

analyzed: rmi lam gyi ma gtogs te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam gyi bzhag ste'o // dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: ltung ba de dge 'dun la rag lus pa dang / dge 'dun @286b dang 'brel pa dang / dge 'dun la rten pa yin te /

analyzed: ltung ba de dge 'dun las rnam par ldang bar 'gyur gyi gang zag las ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang pham par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi po dag ni lhag ma med pa yin gyi /

original: 'di ni lhag ma dang bcas pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni lhag ma dang bcas pa yin pa ste /

original: des na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: des na dge 'dun lhag ma'o zhes gsungs so //

original: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de la ltung ba ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How does one commit this offense?

original: gzhi lnga ste /
analyzed: gzhi lnga ste /

analyzed: bde ba 'dod pa dang / sa bon 'dod pa dang / rig sngags 'dod pa dang / sman 'dod pa dang / brtag pa 'dod pas so //
translated: One who desires pleasure, one who desires seeds, one who desires a spell, one who desires medicine, and one who desires an examination.

analyzed: ji ltar bde ba 'dod pas she na /

analyzed: dge slong gis bde ba 'dod pas nang gi gzugs nye bar len cing sems par byed /

analyzed: khu ba ma 'byin na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //

translated: Just as with one who desires pleasure, so it is with one who desires seeds, one who desires a spell, one who desires medicine, and one who desires an examination.

analyzed: dge slong gis bde ba 'dod pas nang gi gzugs nye bar len cing sems par byed /

analyzed: rtsol bar byed / ril gyis 'chang bar byed /
translated: strives,🔽holds it in,

analyzed: khu ba 'byin na dge 'dun lhag mar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: khu ba mi 'byin na nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ro //

analyzed: bde ba 'dod pas ji lta ba bzhin du sa bon 'dod pa /

analyzed: rig sngags 'dod pa dang / sman 'dod pa dang; brtag pa 'dod pas kyang de bzhin no //

analyzed: dge slong gis bde ba 'dod pas /
translated: If a monk desires pleasure,
